education.institution: KTH, Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
KTH, Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden

publications.name: Learning to Ground Existentially Quantified Goals
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Twenty-First International Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR 2024)
publications.summary: Here we study how to learn to ground existentially quantified goals in Classical Planning. This is an important problem as human instructions tend to result in quantified goals rather than grounded, but many planners do not support quantified goals.

publications.name: CiteBench: A benchmark for Scientific Citation Text Generation
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2023 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP), 2023
publications.summary: In this paper, we introduce CiteBench, a benchmark for scientific citation text generation. CiteBench is a large-scale dataset for citation text generation, unifying multiple tasks in a single benchmark.

publications.name: Combining sentence and table evidence to predict veracity of factual claims using TaPaS and RoBERTa
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Fourth Workshop on Fact Extraction and VERification (FEVER), 2021
publications.summary: The paper proposes a method for solving the FEVEROUS task, which is a task of predicting the veracity of factual claims using both sentence and table evidence.

work.name: Netlight AB
work.summary: Worked as a Software Engineering consultant for various clients, ranging from governmental agencies to media magnates. Tasks varied from front-end and back-end development to handling communication with clients.

work.name: Atiendo AB
work.summary: Software Engineer working mostly on various web applications, and data visualization projects.
